author: September 28, 2015
title: 5 Best Alternatives to Windows Movie Maker
text:
September 28, 2015
First things first: I was a Windows PC fanboy before I became a Mac convert. Now, with the advent of smartphones with built-in high power and fast cameras, one can easily dump his/her digital camera or video camcorder to capture precious moments.
With storage devices getting cheaper day-by-day, people are now taking more videos of their lives than photos. If you are in dire need of editing a video file but do not have Windows Movie Maker installed in your PC (and of course, they do not have it on the Mac), here are 5 best alternatives to the video editing software to have around.
YOUTUBE MOVIE MAKER
Perhaps, the ultimate goal why you need to edit home videos is to upload them to YouTube and share your wonderful work to all netizens. This app is specifically made with YouTube as the video sharing platform in mind. The software interface is very nice and easy to use (very newbie friendly). Gives you access to the basic tools in adding titles, and even creating karaoke videos with lyrics in them. Once you’re done editing, uploading to YouTube is just a click away. For a premium, you will have access to features like ability to create 3D videos and automatically promote uploaded videos in YouTube.
Website: http://www.makeyoutubevideo.com| License: Freemium
VIDEOPAD VIDEO EDITOR
VideoPad is intuitive and was designed for creating professional quality videos in minutes. Features include drag and drop capability for easy video editing, application of effects and transitions, adjust video speed and export your work for DVD, HD and even YouTube. Aside from Windows and Mac OS versions of this app, iOS and Android users can also enjoy its features and functionality on their mobile devices.
Website: http://www.nchsoftware.com/videopad| License: FREE (for non-commercial use)
AVID MEDIA COMPOSER
If you want to add Hollywood-style effects (around 120 of them) to your home videos, then Avid Media Composer is the software that you should use. For a subscription of less than US$30 per month, you will be able to use the same software trusted by professional editors for movies, television, broadcast and streaming media. Media Composer supports accelerated high-res and HD workflows, real-time collaboration and media management for faster delivery of video content.
Website: https://www.avid.com/US/products/media-composer| License: US$29.99/month
EZVid
Currently runs on all flavors of Microsoft Windows, this software allows you to create a Video Wiki. Ezvid is a freeware HD video maker, slideshow maker, screen recorder, and movie maker. The software imports images and video, and uploads the end product directly to YouTube.
Website: http://www.ezvid.com | License: Free
LIGHTWORKS
Lightworks is an Academy and Emmy award-winning, professional Non-Linear Editing (NLE) software supporting resolutions up to 4K (talking about SD and HD formats) from EditShare. This software has been used to edit some of the finest films in cinema history like LA Confidential, Pulp Fiction, Heat, Road to Perdition, Hugo, The King’s Speech and many more! Current version of Lightworks runs on Windows, Mac OS and Linux. The FREE edition of this tool enables budding video editors to have real-time tilting effects, multicam editing, second monitor output, and import from vast number of video formats. A subscription-based Lightworks Pro adds the functionality of project sharing; AJA, Blackmagic and Matrox I/O support among others.
Website: http://www.lwks.com| License: Freemium (BOB REYES)
